Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Better JavaScript Shell Scripting with Bun Shell â€” Performance-focused server-side runtime Bun continues its rapid evolution with a side quest into the world of shell scripting by making it easier, cross-platform friendly, and less verbose. zx offers similar (but less integrated and focused) functionality to Node users, if you should prefer.

Jarred Sumner (Bun)

Announcing AdonisJS v6 â€” If you want a backend Web framework with amazing docs and packed with features, Adonis is a good choice. v6 is a big step forward moving to ESM by default, with more type safety overall (including for routes and middleware references), a new validation library, and more.

Harminder Virk

Learn Vite, The Fast Build Tool for Modern Web Projects â€” Join Steve Kinney for this video course tour of Vite's capabilities, including a look at bundling, optimizing static assets, hot module reloading, and its plugin ecosystem. You'll come away proficient at using Vite to build scalable, performant apps.

Frontend Masters sponsor

QuickJS: The Small, Embeddable JavaScript Engine â€” Several years ago, Fabrice Bellard, the genius behind FFMPEG and JSLinux, built a tiny and complete JavaScript engine in C. It now supports ES2023 and its latest release adds top-level await in modules and its REPL, as well as support for some cutting edge JS features (changelog).

Fabrice Bellard

IN BRIEF:

  • @npm_malware on Twitter/X shares malicious packages detected in real time.

  • JetBrains has opened up its Early Access Program for WebStorm 2024.1, its commercial JS/TS IDE.

  • ğŸ“… React Conf 2024 takes place this May 15-16 online and at Lake Las Vegas.

RELEASES:

  • Astro 4.2 â€“ The framework that never ceases to amaze.

  • Node.js 21.6.1 (Current) â€“ A bug fix for Undici.

  • Puppeteer 21.9 â€“ Now using Chromium 121.

  • Next.js 14.1, Qwik 1.4, Expo Router v3, Redux Toolkit 2.1

ğŸ“’ Articles & Tutorials

Web Components in Earnest â€” This is.. epic! If you want to really get a walk through the journey of building an entire app using Web Components and JavaScript, this is it. The app in this case is simple, but complete, and the author shows off the realities of going all in with Web Components here.

David Bryant Copeland

â–¶  An Alpine, HTMX, and Astro-Based Wordle App â€” Popular dev YouTuber Jack demonstrates building a Wordle clone with a modern Alpine, HTMX and Astro-based stack. Or you can go straight to the code, if you prefer.

Jack Herrington

Complete Your AI Coding Experience with Wallaby.js â€” Get instant test feedback and powerful debugging for AI code suggestions.

Wallaby Team sponsor

How to Start a React Project in 2024 â€” Robin explains the pros and cons of a few common approaches, including using Vite, Astro, and Next.js.

Robin Wieruch

Build a Next.js App in Storybook with React Server Components and Mock Service Worker â€” How to develop, document, and test RSC apps in isolation, while using MSW to mock network requests.

Michael Shilman

Reversing and Tooling a Signed Request Hash in Obfuscated JS
Brett Buerhaus

Create a Currency Converter with HTML, CSS, and Vanilla JavaScript
Esther Vaati

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

Jint 3.0: A JavaScript Interpreter for .NET â€” Run JavaScript within a .NET app and expose .NET objects and functions to JavaScript code. v3 arrives after seven years of work and is the most standards-compliant JS engine running entirely within .NET.

SÃ©bastien Ros

Mutative: A Library for Efficient Immutable Updates â€” A library for efficient immutable updates, boasting being 2-6x faster than naive handcrafted reducers, and even more than 10x faster than Immer. GitHub repo.

Michael Lin

Auth Without Complexity â€” Authentication in a Straightforward Platform â€” Userfront streamlines authentication & access control so engineers can focus on their core business. Read the docs now.

Userfront sponsor

React Email 2.0: Build Better Emails with React â€” React Email is a collection of unstyled components for creating emails using JSX and React (this example shows you the basic idea).

Gabriel Miranda (Resend)

workerpool 9.1: Offload Tasks to a Pool of Workers â€” A long established thread pool library that works not only on Node but also in the browser.

Jos de Jong

Microsoft TypeSpec: A TypeScript-Inspired Way to Define APIs â€” A language for concisely describing cloud service APIs and generating other API description languages (e.g. OpenAPI), client and service code, docs, and more. Formerly known as CADL. â€“ GitHub repo.

Microsoft

Receive, Authenticate, Transform, Filter, Route, and Deliver Webhooks â€” The Hookdeck Event Gateway is a reliable platform to support event-driven application development across the full development lifecycle.

Hookdeck sponsor

Partytown 0.9: Run Third Party Scripts in a Web Worker â€” A way to run resource intensive scripts on a separate thread (in a web worker) to let the main thread remain responsive. GitHub repo.

Partytown

pretty-ms 9.0: Convert Milliseconds to Readable Strings â€” 1337000000 â†’ 15d 11h 23m 20s

Sindre Sorhus

nmea.js: A Library to Parse Maritime Electronics Data â€” Iâ€™d never even heard of NMEA till now, but if you work with sonars, gyrocompasses, and similar marine electronics, this is for you.

Bruno Vieira

#â€‹670 â€” January 11, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Is htmx Just Another JavaScript Framework? â€” Despite being four years old, htmx has seen a surge in popularity recently, parly due to fatigue with 'big frameworks' and also because its simple HTML-based approach to adding functionality to a page appeals to an increasingly diverse group. But is it just another framework itself? Yes. And no.

Alexander Petros

â–¶  HTMX for React Developers in 10 Minutes â€” You're not interested in discussions about semantics.. you just want to get something done with htmx? Here, Jack takes ten minutes to show off the essentials.

Jack Herrington

Add Excel-like Spreadsheet Functionality to Your JavaScript Apps â€” SpreadJS is the industry-leading JavaScript spreadsheet for adding advanced spreadsheet features to your enterprise apps. Build finance, analysis, budget, and other apps. Excel I/O, 500+ calc functions, tables, charts, and more. View demos now.

SpreadJS from MESCIUS inc sponsor

33 JavaScript Concepts Every Developer Should Know â€” A curated collection of links to tutorials on 33 different areas worth understanding well, including: types, closures, equality, scope, and different engines. We linked this two years ago, but it remains frequently updated.

Leonardo Maldonado

Introducing fsx: A Modern Filesystem API for JavaScript â€” Filesystem APIs in JavaScript runtimes havenâ€™t been great for a long time. This is one prominent JavaScript expertâ€™s attempt to make a better one.

Nicholas C. Zakas

IN BRIEF:

  • CodePen shares its top 100 'pens' of 2023. Lots of fantastic bits and pieces to look through and learn from here.

  • Bored? The Deno team is running a little hackathon over the next week.

  • jsfree.org is a new effort to catalog web services that can work without JavaScript.

  • ğŸŒ¼ Enjoy the drawing.garden.

RELEASES:

  • Docusaurus 3.1 â€“ Popular site generator/framework.

  • Rspack 0.5 â€“ Fast Rust-based web bundler.

  • MikroORM 6 â€“ TypeScript ORM for Node.js.

  • Node.js v20.11.0 (LTS), Bun 1.0.22, npm 10.3 and Astro 4.1.

ğŸ“’ Articles & Tutorials

The Website vs. Web App Dichotomy Doesn't Exist â€” An interesting think piece that will help you flesh out your own opinions on the matter: â€œIf thereâ€™s one takeaway from all this, itâ€™s that the web is a flexible medium where any number of technologies can be combined in all sorts of interesting ways.â€

Jake Lazaroff

Rust-Based JavaScript Linters: Fast, But No Typed Linting Right Now â€” An explanation of why the speed gains from Rust-powered linters arenâ€™t comparable to the full feature set of typescript-eslint.

Josh Goldberg

Reduce 80%+ Latency with Vercel Edge Functions â€” Learn how TiDB Serverless + Vercel Edge Functions can significantly reduce latency for global users. Read now!

TiDB sponsor

The State of Benchmarking in Node.js â€” While Node has always been fast (thanks largely to its V8 underpinnings), thereâ€™s a renewed focus on performance in the face of benchmarks and claims from alternatives like Deno and Bun. Lars looks at the ecosystem of benchmarking options in the space.

Lars Kappert

A CSS Media Query for Scripting Support â€” A new media query (e.g. @media (scripting: none)) was just added to Chrome (and Edge) to let you to define styles upon whether scripting languages are available. It's supported in all major browsers now â€“ a rare case of Chromium playing catch-up!

Stephanie Stimac

â–¶  What is Remix Exactly? â€” As in Remix, the full-stack web framework.

Alem Tuzlak

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

zip.js: Library to Zip and Unzip Files â€” Sounds simple, and it is, but it supports a couple of different formats and can generate password protected ZIPs. There are a few demos, but the simplest one sold me on its own. GitHub repo.

Gildas Lormeau

Element Plus: Vue 3 Component Library â€” Out of the box you get a large variety of clean components with a minimal vibe. You can see them in action here.

Element Plus Team

Add Authorization, MFA, Biometrics and More to Your JavaScript App in Just Minutes â€” It's about time that somebody talked some sense about OAuth and JavaScript. So we did. You're welcome.

FusionAuth sponsor

RE2JS: Linear Time Matching for Regular Expressions â€” RE2 is a regex engine built by Google designed to operate in time proportional to the size of the input, in order to avoid so-called â€˜ReDoSâ€™ problems backtracking can cause. There are bindings for Node.js, but this version works in the browser.

Oleksii Vasyliev

Penrose: Beautiful Math Diagrams by Writing Plain Text â€” It might sound a little like Mermaid (indeed, their homepages are strikingly similar) but its scope feels somewhat more math-focused â€“ there are many examples.

Penrose Contributors

DOMPurify 3.0.8: A Fast, Tolerant XSS Sanitizer for HTML â€” Supports all modern browsers and is heavily tested. Thereâ€™s a live demo here.

Cure53

remoteStorage: Cross Browser/Device Persistence â€” Combines the localStorage API with a remote server to persist data across browsers and devices â€“ so basically, imagine localStorage but remote. Hereâ€™s the server part.

Frigade

  • eslint-plugin-vue 9.20.0 â€“ The official ESLint plugin for Vue.js now supports Vue 3.4. Homepage.

  • file-type 19.0 â€“ Detect file type from a Buffer, Uint8Array, or ArrayBuffer.

  • React Unity WebGL 9.5 â€“ Embed Unity WebGL builds in React apps.

  • htmlparser2 9.1 â€“ A fast and forgiving HTML/XML parser.

  • YouTube.js 8.2 â€“ Wrapper around YouTube's internal API.

  • React-PDF 7.7 â€“ React component to display PDFs.

  • HLS.js 1.5 â€“ HTTP Live Streaming client library.

  • React Icons 5.0 â€“ Easily use popular icons in React apps.

  • Chai 5.0 â€“ BDD / TDD assertion library.
